page.title: 16RECREATION IN KETTLEWELL
page.content: Wharfedale House - Once a private house, this was bought by a group of Huddersfield men, Round Tablers, etc. who ran a marathon and other efforts to found a hostel which formerly helped deprived or maladjusted children to enjoy the countryside. Now, with a resident warden and wife, it caters for groups from the Kirklees area. Within the community, a variety of activities takes place, with emphasis on the period October to March. There is a W.I., a Badminton Club, Horticultural Society, an annual bonfire, children's party, with home produced pantomime, charity fancy dress evenings, fell and canoe races, darts and domino teams, rugby and cricket enthusiasts, carol singing to nearby hamlets, and impromptu dancing round the Maypole on New Year's Eve.
